abstract.p: Thalle Construction Company, road and utility contractor, is awarded $29 million contract for latest reconstruction work on Taconic State Parkway (S)

block.p: The Thalle Construction Company, a road and utility contractor based in Briarcliff Manor in Westchester County, has been awarded a $29 million contract for the latest reconstruction work on the Taconic State Parkway. The work is to involve rebuilding stretches of the parkway and making safety improvements in Yorktown.

The State Department of Transportation said that the material used would be Superpave, an asphalt that was developed to be resistant to problems, like cracking and rutting, that are caused by low temperature and fatigue.

The Thalle Construction Company, a road and utility contractor based in Briarcliff Manor in Westchester County, has been awarded a $29 million contract for the latest reconstruction work on the Taconic State Parkway. The work is to involve rebuilding stretches of the parkway and making safety improvements in Yorktown.

The State Department of Transportation said that the material used would be Superpave, an asphalt that was developed to be resistant to problems, like cracking and rutting, that are caused by low temperature and fatigue.

Gov. George E. Pataki said that 42,000 vehicles use the Taconic daily. He added that Superpave is expected to last 20 years instead of the 15-year service life of regular asphalt. The work is expected to begin within a week and to be completed by November 2001, according to the State Department of Transportation.
